pullrequest.title: Suppport for the Polaris XP900 vehicle

pull_request.title: Suppport for the Polaris XP900 vehicle

update.description:
It depends on the [Polaris XP900 pull request on gazebo_models repo](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-request/61/added-polaris-ranger-xp900)



* *drc_vehicle*  loads the Polaris EV. I've created a new *drc_vehicle_xp900* with the Polaris XP900.

* I've updated all *drc_practice_xx* worlds, and the *atlas_drc_vehicle_fire_hose.world* to use the XP900 model.

* The PID gains of the vehicle plugin are now loaded from the SDF. That allows to share the same plugin between different vehicles.

* Note that the topics for controlling the vehicle does not change but the model name does.

Turning the Polaris EV wheels:

```
#!c++

rostopic pub --once  /drc_vehicle/hand_wheel/cmd std_msgs/Float64 '{ data : -3.14 }'
```
Turning the Polaris XP900 wheels:

```
#!c++

rostopic pub --once  /drc_vehicle_xp900/hand_wheel/cmd std_msgs/Float64 '{ data : -3.14 }'

```
update.title: Suppport for the Polaris XP900 vehicle

pull_request.title: Suppport for the Polaris XP900 vehicle

pullrequest.title: Suppport for the Polaris XP900 vehicle

content.raw: Currently handWheelForce is set in the constructor. It could be nice to make this an sdf parameter as well. I made this value very low so that it would be easier for Atlas to turn the steering wheel with its hands, but it makes the tele-op cheats not work very well. It it was an sdf parameter, it would be much easier to adjust.
content.html: Currently handWheelForce is set in the constructor. It could be nice to make this an sdf parameter as well. I made this value very low so that it would be easier for Atlas to turn the steering wheel with its hands, but it makes the tele-op cheats not work very well. It it was an sdf parameter, it would be much easier to adjust.

pullrequest.title: Suppport for the Polaris XP900 vehicle

content.raw:
We are not including by default in our launch files the spawn of the Polaris, right? It does not appear automatically after launching drc_practice_task_1 for example.

I can insert the model manually, get a [visual warning](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-request/61/added-polaris-ranger-xp900/diff#comment-862320), but I'm unable to see any rostopic related to the vehicle. I'm probably missing something.
content.html:
We are not including by default in our launch files the spawn of the Polaris, right? It does not appear automatically after launching drc_practice_task_1 for example.

I can insert the model manually, get a visual warning, but I'm unable to see any rostopic related to the vehicle. I'm probably missing something.
